title: Malaysia: Learning by Doing at Citi Stock Challenge
summary: Kuala Lumpur – Sekolah Menengah Kebangsaan Pusat Bandar Puchong from Kuala Lumpur together with Chung Ling High School and Sekolah Menengah Jenis Kebangsaan Convent Datuk Keramat from Penang emerged winners at the annual Citi Stock Challenge 2011.
tag-1: Malaysia: Learning by Doing at Citi Stock Challenge
tag-3: Kuala Lumpur – Sekolah Menengah Kebangsaan Pusat Bandar Puchong from Kuala Lumpur together with Chung Ling High School and Sekolah Menengah Jenis Kebangsaan Convent Datuk Keramat from Penang emerged winners at the annual Citi Stock Challenge 2011.
tag-4: The three winning teams, comprising three students on each team, out-invested 33 schools and 540 students, who participated in this year's challenge.
tag-5: During the six-day challenge held in Penang and Kuala Lumpur, the 16-year-old students adopted the role of stockbrokers after learning the fundamentals of trading, market trends and taking positions on counters.
tag-6: They were given RM1,000 'seed money' to trade in a simulated stock market that featured 20 stocks in five sectors ranging from energy, manufacturing, trade, communications to hospitality.
tag-7: "As an advocate of responsible finance, we believe in financial education that focuses on teaching how to manage money, how to invest in the stock market and how to understand the benefits of saving and investing," said Fabio Fontainha, Consumer Markets Head, Citibank Berhad. "These will benefit people of all ages, especially the younger generation as it gives them a better foundation to make more informed decisions in the future about their financial well-being. The Citi Stock Challenge is one of many relevant educational platforms that Citi uses to expose young Malaysians on responsible financial management."
tag-8: The Citi Stock Challenge aims to introduce young students in Malaysia to stock market fundamentals, increase their financial literacy and investment knowledge. Since the launch of the challenge in 2004, more than 2000 students from all over the country have taken part.
tag-9: Citi and Learning Society, a non-profit organization that promotes active learning, jointly organized the Citi Stock Challenge. It is also supported by a funding grant from the Citi Foundation, which further cements Citi's global commitment to heighten awareness on the importance of financial education.
tag-10: Citi Citi, the leading global financial services company, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Through Citicorp and Citi Holdings, Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management. Additional information may be found at www.citigroup.com.
tag-11: Citi's Office of Financial Capability Citi's Office of Financial Capability combines the strength of Citi's business, people and partnerships to empower individuals to achieve their personal finance goals and improve their quality of life. Citi takes a holistic approach to Financial Capability that encompasses four elements critical to achieving sustainable results: 1) increasing financial literacy; 2) developing short-term and long-term financial plans; 3) increasing ability to select appropriate financial products or services to implement those plans; and 4) providing ongoing support that helps consumers redefine their financial goals over the course of their lives. In 2004, Citi made an unprecedented 10-year, $200 million global commitment to support financial education. As of 2010, the company has invested over $167 million in these efforts in 73 countries around the world.
tag-12: Citi Foundation The Citi Foundation is committed to the economic empowerment and financial inclusion of individuals and families, particularly those in need, in the communities where we work so that they can improve their standard of living. Globally, the Citi Foundation targets its strategic giving to priority focus areas: Microfinance, Enterprise Development, Youth Education and Livelihoods, and Financial Capability and Asset Building. The Citi Foundation works with its partners in Microfinance and Enterprise Development to support environmental programs and innovations. Additional information can be found at www.citifoundation.com.
tag-13: About The Learning Society The Learning Society was established as a public service organization with goals of promoting and supporting progressive educational programs for adults and children.
